answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Toni,
Here are some resources for you:
This Mesa, AZ Management Performance and Accountability Director job description mentions staff development on the third page. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14957/MPA_Director_Job_Description 
Petaluma, CA requires staff development for its city manager.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2825/City_Manager_Job_Description_City_of_Petaluma
In Evanston, IL, there is a mention of staff development on page 4 of this Superintendent of Streets and Sanitation.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14511/Superintendent_Street__Sanitation_Brochure
I hope this helps. Please let us know if you need more information.
Thanks,
Max Moline
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Toni Shope
text:
A locality is looking to identify those who are including leadership/staff development as part of job descriptions. If you are doing this in your organization or have specific examples please let me know.  
Thank you.
title: Staff Development Tied to Job Description
